subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
Egypt is embarking on a process of decentralization. Urban institutions are looking forward to implementing a modality where the coordinated roles of central and local institutions can coordinate regulation and implementation of sought strategic plans under development. Preparing decentralized and participatory visions for development and monitoring their implementation is the core of a process which seeks to effectively manage urban policy. The Strategic Urban Development Plan for the Greater Cairo Region will contribute to its sustainable development and increase its competitiveness on both the regional and global levels.  In the short-term, this will be achieved through:
1- Strengthening the global linkages and integration between the existing urban built-up area and new urban communities
2- Defining the economic role and the competitive economic clusters of the region to leverage their potentials
3- Increasing the efficiency of the institutional framework  for managing the region
4- Consolidating the active participation of key stakeholders in the decision-making and planning process through strategic planning approach

The project aims to achieve the following outputs:
- Capacity of local actors in the Greater Cairo  Region stregthened in participatory and strategic planning, management and implementation
- Strategic urban development plan for GCR in place
- Detailed urban plan and feasibility studies for subsidiary projects in place
- Urban observatory for GCR established
subproject.title: GCR Strategic Urban Dev. Plan
